title: Which inkjet printer has the easiest ink cartridges? - Quora

response.answer_text: The easiest to install ink would need to be the blocks of solid ink used by some older printers including the Xerox Phaser 8560. For better or worse, the technology got left behind in favor of color laser printers. Even the new “Phaser” printers use color laser technology. Personally, I would avoid inkjets completely as they are money pits. See: Scott King Walker's answer to What products are relatively cheap to buy, but expensive to own?

Ink jet cartridges are all “easy” to remove and reinsert. The best (and most costly) are the HP style that put print head and ink supply in the same package. IF you could still find one, a HP printer using a 45 and 78 cartridges are likely the cheapest ever made.
